reviews.text: We had the best meal (by far) of our current trip to Italy at Ristorante Gallura, on a trip that was planned entirely around the food and restaurants (Sicily and Sardinia). Fantastic, creative dishes of all types -- amazing fried anchovies, shrimp, calimari, and John Dory, salads, soup, finished with a whole grilled fish that was one of the best we've ever had. We had probably 10 courses in total, splitting most of them among our group of 4. The service was great, once we made it clear to the waiter that we were putting ourselves in his hands for the night.
reviews.title: Wow -- an amazing experience

reviews.text: I think the disconnect with the other reviews here is that this is a place where you need to be able to let go and let them bring you whatever is best. We did have choices, but there is no written menu, and we relied on the waiter to guide us to what was best that night. If you are very picky about knowing exactly what you are going to eat, and being able to choose precisely what you want, you will not be happy here. But if you mostly care about the quality of the food (both ingredients and preparation), you can have a terrific experience.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers-eque

reviews.text: The older woman referenced so rudely in another review is the owner of the restaurant, who visits every table and checks on her guests, despite her limited language ability (she speaks Italian and German). We appreciated her interest and the care she clearly takes in every detail of the food.
reviews.title: Vegetarians beware!!
Another of life's lessons
reviews.text: The cost was very reasonable for what we received -- about 300 euros for 4 people. This restaurant is well worth a detour; we are planning a return trip to Sardinia and you can be sure we will spend a night in Olbia just to eat again at Ristorante Gallura.

It was so bad it became funny. Everything was wrong right from the beginning. The old and stale fish antipasti as you walked in set the tone for the evening I think! The hopeless greeting before being seated at our table made me want to turn around and walk straight out again. Our waiter was so rude (and ridiculous) the entire evening. He didn't even tell us what was on the menu.
reviews.title: my favorite restaurant in Sardinia
